Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: This here is a radon test kit. [holding out tiny cylinder disc] Okay I will be putting 'em everywhere. And... please don't throw these out. [starts snapping towards Michael's face] This is a radon test kit. [continues snapping] Please don't throw these out. [Michael gives annoyed look] See them all over the office.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Toby has been leaving radon kits everywhere, like he owns the place. The first time I threw mine away, I thought it was an ant trap. [finds radon kit in between his blinds in his office] But I figured I'd rather live with ants than with his creepy little disc. [throws it away] The second time... I thought it was one of those, you know, those things you turn over and it moos. [finds another radon kit on top of his cabinet] Like a cow thing. But upon closer examination, it was another ant trap, so I threw it away. And the third time... I did it out of spite. [takes radon kit from the top of the blinds of his office window and slams it into the trash can]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pfffffttt.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Come on, Michael. You're interrupting.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're kidding me? God! You say radon is silent, but deadly, and then you expect me not to make farting noises with my mouth? What is this?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Please sit down.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what? We're not gonna die of radon, we're gonna die of boredom.

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: YEAH! [laughter]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Right? And if I had a gun with two bullets and I was in a room with Hitler, Bin Laden, and Toby, I would shoot Toby twice.

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: No. No!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's... not okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, alright.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You were being really funny, and then you went too far.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I would kill Bin Laden and then Toby.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, hmmm... that's still...

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: Mm-mm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay geniuses, how would you do it?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Curve the bullet. Like in my favorite James McAvoy film, Wanted.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: All that does is help you shoot around things. What does Bin Laden...

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Is there a curtain rod in the room?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: How about make-believe land has anything you want?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Stanley, please, this is serious!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Is this the thing where they use an icicle so there's no evidence?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, we stab Toby through the heart with an icicle.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Come on, the whole two bullet thing is a red herring. Here's how you do it:

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What flavors did you get? [yawns]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: It's so exciting Pam. The Eagles are doing a theme of ice creams in honor of turning 60.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [reading flavors] Despera-dough. Witchy-womanilla. Why do they do this?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Do you want me to go back to the store?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, no, no, it's fine. I was just commenting. We gotta get these out, open 'em up.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: This is all for Michael. It turns out his girlfriend was married.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, and when Michael gets a broken heart, this whole place comes to a halt, so we're just trying to get out in front of this.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: After his last breakup, he ate 40,000 calories in three hours. Right, Pam? That's what Pam told me.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [yawns] Yeah, or no... well... I don't know. I'm sorry. I was up all night with Cece, otherwise I'd be running this.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: That's okay. You probably shouldn't keep a baby up that late, though.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: We have Mr. Bean playing in the conference room and the Pink Panther movie in his office. With half hour shifts to watch it with him.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And we need bodies in both these rooms, people. So please sign up.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: He's coming.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, okay. Everyone, remember, when he get's like this, he will wallow, if you empathize. Keep conversations light and if you get stuck, and you don't know what to do, make a random sound effect okay? Farting noise, whatever. Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [walks in] Hey everyone.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, out! Get out now! Leave now.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Leave, get outta here.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Leave!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Right now!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, and if he makes a joke, just laugh it up, no matter what. Okay?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [walks in] Morning everyone.

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: Hey! [applauses] Hey, hey!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hi Michael. [gives him a hug]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael, nice tie or something.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, thank you. It's reversible, I think. [everyone laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: That's hilarious.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's awesome. You want some ice cream?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh! Oh wow, are those Eagles' flavors? Cake it to the Limit. That's my favorite! I love that! Too much for me to have by myself. Anybody wanna share?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Boi-oi-oi-ing

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Well... that's random. I will dig into those later.

Quote.Speaker: Lawyer
Quote.Text: I don't follow this exactly. Uh, "The Descendants of any replicants from this union shall have..."

Quote.Speaker: Dwight and Angela
Quote.Text: Joint custody

Quote.Speaker: Lawyer
Quote.Text: Are we talking about your grandchildren?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Rather than spend all day in court, we've decided to settle our dispute using a mediator. It was an option spelled out in our childrearing contract.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Alleged contract.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Alleged? I'm going to own your farm by the time this is over.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Just try. I will do legal jujitsu on you. Gyah! [pretends to karate chop her neck] See, don't even need to make contact. The law will do it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So much of this is just impossible to verify. Item five, point "B", uh... the beet juice cleanse?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I'm doing it. You know I am. It's disgusting.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: How do we know this? I'd like to see a stool sample.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Dwight, look at my teeth. [shows teeth, beet red]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Eughh. [looks disgusted]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No secret crying. Hasn't even opened the tissue box in there.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Could he still be seeing her?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I don't think he'd do that.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So we're gonna say the most likely scenerio is that Michael matured overnight?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, it happened to Tom Hanks in Big.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Exactly. It happened in Big.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I gotta go. Text me later.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm really too tired to do this.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Me too!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Then let's just not do this. Do you have any idea the risks involved?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We were wondering if you would like to have dinner with us tonight, in our home, and play with our baby.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We can order in from Hooters.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, Hooters to go. Nice.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We can watch a movie and play Rock Band.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Billy Joel Rock Band.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That... exists?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, well, I'll have to take a rain check, but thanks for the offer.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [shouts] Michael Scott, are you still seeing Donna?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, Pam... she's not invisible so stop asking silly questions.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Since when is this an office where we delve into each other's personal lives?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I like Donna. Is it wrong to keep seeing her? Depends on who you ask. I mean, if you ask her husband... or you took a random poll, yeah, it's wrong.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: That is something I would never do.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, I think we all know what you're capable of Meredith.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Hey, I have never cheated on, been cheated on, or been used to cheat with.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I ask... everyone in the room, "Are you in a relationship?".

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: People, this is Scranton. And many people consider that to be the Paris of northeastern Pennsylvania. And in Paris, it is rude for a woman to have less than four lovers.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Eughh, Ryan, I do not want you hanging around Michael anymore.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I will have you know that I asked Donna about this and she is fine with it. And just to be sure, I asked her again afterward. Same answer.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: How does he feel about it?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: He is never gonna find out. He is a high school baseball coach. He wakes up early. He goes to bed early. Look at how long it took for him to find out. [points to Andy] It was right under his nose. I had to tell him.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Now you're just being hurtful.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, it... why is it okay for Stanley to cheat or for Phyllis to cheat...

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: On her diet! He's a sports guy. He's scummy. Dogfighting. Drugs. They spit.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Did Donna tell you that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Real sports with Bryant Gumble.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: So you're just making a giant assumption. You don't even know the guy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what? You know what? I am declaring a moment of silence right now. Ten minutes of silence honoring Michael Jackson. just sit there and think about Michael jackson.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: My name is Andy Bernard and I am a cuckold. For those of you unfamiliar with William Shakespeare, a cuckold is a man whose woman is cheating on him. I've lived the part. And let me tell you, I'd so much rather play the part on stage.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: So... here's the thing about infidelity.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mm, no, when are you people going to stop casting the first stone? I am not in the wrong here. I am the good guy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: How does that work?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do you think this husband is a super sweet nice guy? Do you think he's an angel? I don't think so. Why is his wife going off and having a little something-something with me? There has to be a problem with him.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: In any cheating movie, the person getting cheated on is the hero. You're Ali Larter, I'm Beyonce.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am Beyonce always.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Not this time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, I am.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: This guy's a high school baseball coach, right? Let's go check him out, see what a horrible person he is.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I would love that.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah. Those teams have games and practices every day. Let's go check it out.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I have work to do.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, really? I thought you were the boss.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Let's go. [starts walking towards the elevator] I can't wait to see this jerk who is making me cheat on his wife. I should punch him in the nose for what he's making me do to her.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [humming Call to Post] Bum bum BUM BUM BUM BUM BUM BUM BUM BUM bum bum

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, Andy, please.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Baseball!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Shh! Try not to draw attention, please. That's him. That's him.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Where?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Right there. The coach!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Stage right or stage left? I played batboy in damn yankees!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Right there. Look, look. Follow my finger. Okay? see? The grownup by the base?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [announcer's voice] And Now, coaching third base with two arms, two legs, and no heart. Capable of feeling pain.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right. Can you just- can you just act normal for a second, please?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Whatever. I'm the one blending in.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: [ahem][Pam snores] Guys?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mm. Hey. Oh, hi, Gabe.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Can you two please join me in my office? Now.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You were supposed to be the Lookout.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, well it's really warm in here. It's like a sleeping bag.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I don't wanna be the heavy here, but honestly, guys, this makes us all look bad.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sorry about that.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So embarrassing.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Good. Okay. End of the dressing down. I just hate that part of the job, you know, the power dynamics.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, you were surprisingly restrained.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We will be well-rested tomorrow.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Okay. That's great, actually, because I wanted to talk to you about something else.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Excellent. Go for it.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I'm sure you got my email about the printer fires. The one with the branching decision tree? I actually designed that chart. Kinda hoping it catches on. [Jim and Pam struggling to stay awake] Anyway, the question is, what is the best way to disseminate important information in an efficient way?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Right? So, uh, let's uh...

Quote.Speaker: Lawyer
Quote.Text: Finally there's a provision here in the occurrence that the child is born an old man, a la Benjamin Button.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Same page. Go to the next one.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Same page. Just keep moving.

Quote.Speaker: Lawyer
Quote.Text: Despite the provision covering whether this is all part of the matrix-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Which we can't know.

Quote.Speaker: Lawyer
Quote.Text: This is essentially...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Unless we're unplugged.

Quote.Speaker: Lawyer
Quote.Text: Equivalent to a donor or surrogate contractor.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And wake up in the future.

Quote.Speaker: Lawyer
Quote.Text: Which is actually pretty common. So I have to tell you that this is a solid contract.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Lawyer
Quote.Text: Look, I can't enforce that anybody have a child with anyone else.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Lawyer
Quote.Text: So essentially, this comes down to damages. Now, there is some precedence for the range of $30,000.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I don't have $30,000 lying around. I have it buried very deeply, and I don't want to dig past a certain someone to get it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Chase Dixon is up. Could be a big play.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You have no idea what you're talking about.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I know it's like cricket.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You don't. No, no.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: And it's-there's- well, home plate is like a wicket.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You don't know. You don't- you don't know anything. Look at him. Look at him over there. High-fiving? He didn't even do anything. Kid did all the work. I bet he does that at home. I bet it's like, "Hey, Donna, why don't you wash the dishes?" "High-five, Donna." "Hey, why don't you bring me my slippers?" "Hi-five. I'm taking all the credit."

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Seems pretty well liked by the team.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, well, that's because he's paying their salary.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You do know that high school coaches don't pay their players.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know, I know, I know. It-I'm-it- that was a euphemism.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: $30,000? There's gotta be another way.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: He has a 60-acre beet farm that is worth a small fortune.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Look, I will not pay.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Well, I have an alternative.[hands Dwight a document]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: "Intercourse to completion. Five individual times rendered at my discretion?"

Quote.Speaker: Lawyer
Quote.Text: Look, I don't think that's actually legal.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Agreed. [shakes hands with Angela]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Five times for $30,000? Not a bad stud fee. Better than most horses.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: But not in your bed. It's lumpy.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Those lumps are cats, and those cats have names, and those names are Ember, Milky Way, Diane, and Lumpy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Fine. Five times. [signs contract]

Quote.Speaker: Lawyer
Quote.Text: Look, I can't legally watch this unfold. It's coming a little dangerously close to prostitution.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I want eye contact.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Do you understand how rare is that in nature?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I'm not some farm animal. [Dwight smirks at the camera]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Great game, coach.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Shh! Okay, all right. Don't, don't.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You guys are awesome! Best game I've ever seen in my life.

Quote.Speaker: Shane
Quote.Text: Yeah, right. You must be rootin' for the other guys.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ha. The other guys can go die.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [whispers] Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Baseball! Go talk to him.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. God. You go talk to him.

Quote.Speaker: Shane
Quote.Text: Let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Shane. Great game man!

Quote.Speaker: Shane
Quote.Text: Do I know you?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No. Uh, just big fans. Both of us.

Quote.Speaker: Shane
Quote.Text: Are you somebody's... parents? Oh, are you guys... Kenny's dads?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ha. No. No. But we're gay for baseball. [chuckles]

Quote.Speaker: Shane
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: But I have a wife, actually, who I really love a lot.

Quote.Speaker: Shane
Quote.Text: Okay. Let's go!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah. I am so into the institution of marriage.

Quote.Speaker: Shane
Quote.Text: Whoa!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I mean, isn't marriage the best, you know? Two good people finding each other, getting all committed to each other. So you love baseball. What else do you love? Let's round you out as a person.

Quote.Speaker: Shane
Quote.Text: Hey, I'm really sorry, I'm just trying to... focus here on the game.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I get it, man. I love it. That's what makes you a good coach. You know, but as a fan, it just helps me enjoy the game better if I know the coach loves his wife.

Quote.Speaker: Shane
Quote.Text: Of course. Okay? I gotta... get back to this.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Of course.

Quote.Speaker: Shane
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: But real quick, I want you to meet my associate. Sheldon!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Come on, get over here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm good. Oh, my God.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Get- Get over here. Sheldon, say hi to the nice coach.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sorry. I got some stomach cramps.

Quote.Speaker: Shane
Quote.Text: It's all right. It's all right. Keep it going.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, that was not at all what I expected. Hoo hoo! Whoo. My heart's still racing. I just looked a man in the eyes and I shook his hand. All the time I was thinking, "I'm sleeping with your wife." And you know who does that? James freakin' Bond.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, orange slices. There ya go.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Thanks, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't thank me. Thank Dylan's mom. Here you go! Oh! Ooh Hoo Hoo Hoo hoo!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Why would you throw something wet at me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You love it. There ya go.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Now, were those for the team?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh, no, they didn't say team. They just said coal Hawks.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't think those were yours to take.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, then it wouldn't be the first time I stole something away from Coach Shane.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I just wanna go on record as saying that I do not condone this affair, and I went so far as to force Michael to confront the victim of his behavior.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Did you talk to him?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I did.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You talked to the man whose wife you're having an affair with.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Wow. That is crazy.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Was there a fistfight?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. We just talked. He's very nice.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: And it didn't change your mind.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It did not.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Michael, that's awful.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Isn't it?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm awful, aren't I?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah. That's pretty bad.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm an awful guy! Ooh!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: How can you live with yourself?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am what I am, Oscar. And I want what I want. And right now, I want a piece of cake. From now on, when I'm hungry, I am going to eat whatever I am hungry for.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: That is a dangerous game, friendo.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Well, because I thought that it was a book about Anthropology the store.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I don't know why you were in that part of the bookstore.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: 'Cause it's next to they baby section, okay?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: All right, that makes more sense. You should have said that at the beginning when you said, "I read a book about anthropology."

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I don't really know why you're screaming at me right now.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'm not scream- I'm not screaming.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: That's Meredith's cake. It's her birthday.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't care. I have an appetite for life! [eats cake] Mmm. Mmm! Oh, god. That's Lemon.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Good for you, man. Good for you.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: He takes what he wants.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You know what? I think you're attractive, and I wanna sleep with you.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: What about Kelly?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You read my mind.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [quietly] Is this a joke?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: It's hard to live that way man. You gotta really not care what people think about you. I-I don't know how you do it, Michael, I-I-I can't be that cold.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You'll learn, baby. You'll learn.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [pressing buttons to start microwave and moves towards his crotch] I am an honorable man, and I will honor the contract. But I don't have to give her the good stuff. Schrute sperm are strong, [banging on his crotch with drum sticks] but they're no match for a grown Schrute man. [drops yellow pages against his crotch] [screaming] [chuckling] Let's see what she gets. [bouncing crotch on bike and crashes into glass door] [thud] Aah!

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [Michael leaving copy machine] Uh, boss, we're out of paper.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, I noticed that.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Are you gonna add any more?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nope.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: He don't give an "F" about nothin'!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I have got big balls.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't think I'm gonna make it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [yawning] What about an energy drink or something?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [shakes head] It gets in the breast milk. If I drink it, Cece drinks it six hours later.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, it doesn't mean I can't drink it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, it does and it doesn't.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Probably shouldn't tell you this, but a lotta guys in the warehouse work multiple jobs, so... we have a place.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: A place?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: A restful location. Talk to Glen. He'll take you up in the lift.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You sleep in the warehouse?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Lightbulb's burnt out, so it's dark. And the heat from the backup generator keeps it nice and warm. Sometimes I think about it when I'm trying to fall asleep at home. But as far as the rest of the office goes, it doesn't exist, okay?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: For your signature. [drops document on Michael's desk]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. [Phyllis avoids looking at Michael] Phyllis. Okay. Look at me. [continues to look away] Phyllis, look at- [Phyllis turns to leave] okay, that's... [chases after her] All right, all right. You know what? I'm sick of this. I'm sick of the little disapproving head shakes. If you think that's going to have any effect on me, it will not. I am going to leave right now and go to a motel to meet Donna.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Why not your condo?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Because a motel is dirty and it is sexy. Like me. And like Donna. And frankly, the stuff that we're into isn't very condo-appropriate.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Oh, Michael, will you drop it? Everybody's spoken their mind, and no one's changing their mind.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, Morgan Freeman-narrating-everything.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Do you want someone to stop you? 'Cause no one's going to.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nobody better try to stop me. Good. [leaves the office. door closes]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I could have stopped him.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Are you warmed up? [outside sliding door in warehouse]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: God, Angela, why is that always my responsibility? [zipper sound]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What did you do to yourself? [camera pans to Jim and Pam laying down in restful location]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Never mind. Just never mind.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Well, it better work.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, it'll work. [Jim and Pam look shocked and disturbed] Mm. Stop kissing me. It's not in the contract.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [driving in car; returns to office; grabs ice cream out of freezer] How do I feel about breaking up with Donna? Good. Moral. I feel proud. [beeping; cut to Donna who is waiting in the parking lot of the motel] Like a grownup.[Donna receives text from phone] That was not easy because I really liked her a lot. And I'm a little bit emotional right now because I know that I absolutely made the right decision. [Donna has disappointed look; cut back to Michael in his office opening ice cream] At the end of the day, we have to do what's right. And it was either living with myself or... being happy. And I picked... the... former.

Quote.Speaker: Reporter
Quote.Text: Michael Scott?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes?

Quote.Speaker: Reporter
Quote.Text: Do you wanna make a comment on the rumors?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sighs] Umm... I have done some very bad things, things of which I am not proud. I would like to publicly apologize to... the coach and the players. And I vow to never listen to my bodily instincts ever again.

Quote.Speaker: Reporter
Quote.Text: I'm talking about the Sabre printers that catch on fire.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh. Okay. I was talking about... what do- what? What's going on?
